article.headline: Rider 67, Marist 62
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. (AP) -- Jerry Johnson scored 17 points and dished out eight assists to lead Rider to a 67-62 victory over Marist Thursday night. Rider (16-10, 12-5 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) jumped out to an early 6-0 lead as Marist missed its first nine field-goal attempts. The Red Foxes (11-15, 8-9) closed the gap to 16-15 on a free throw by Brandon Ellerbee. But Rider connected on three 3-pointers to close out the first half with a 30-23 lead. Marist took its first lead of the game, 61-60, with 2:12 left in the game on a baseline jumper by Shae McNamara. But Rider's Edwin Muniz hit a 3-pointer with 1:52 remaining to put the Broncs up for good. Rider made four free throws to seal the win. The Broncs shot 80 percent from the foul line, while the Red Foxes shot only 33 percent. Marist's Will McClurkin had 23 points and 11 rebounds, and Will Whittington added 14 points. Muniz finished with 14 points and 12 rebounds, while Paul Johnson chipped in 10 for Rider.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
